materials.raw_text: Ca: 70 g, Pr: 40 g, Sm: 25 g, Sn: 100 g

sourcing.instructions: Calcium (Ca) - Purchase from chemical suppliers or online retailers; Praseodymium (Pr) - Specialty chemical vendors or online sources; Samarium (Sm) - Rare earth element suppliers; Tin (Sn) - Metal suppliers or hardware stores.
steps: Calcium (Ca) - Purchase from chemical suppliers or online retailers; Praseodymium (Pr) - Specialty chemical vendors or online sources; Samarium (Sm) - Rare earth element suppliers; Tin (Sn) - Metal suppliers or hardware stores.

1. Measure out 70 g of Calcium, 40 g of Praseodymium, 25 g of Samarium, and 100 g of Tin using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the measured materials. 3. Use a spatula to mix thoroughly until a uniform blend is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture into a high-purity ceramic crucible for heating.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out 70 g of Calcium, 40 g of Praseodymium, 25 g of Samarium, and 100 g of Tin using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the measured materials. 3. Use a spatula to mix thoroughly until a uniform blend is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture into a high-purity ceramic crucible for heating.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the crucible with the mixture inside the furnace. 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction and fusion of materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the crucible with the mixture inside the furnace. 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction and fusion of materials.

steps: 1. After 4 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled down to prevent thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 4 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled down to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible and extract the solid sample. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant if needed for protection against oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible and extract the solid sample. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant if needed for protection against oxidation.
